thread.title: Hoping my picks do better than the Cubs did
thread.title_full: Hoping my picks do better than the Cubs did

title: Hoping my picks do better than the Cubs did
text:
Hoping my picks do better than the Cubs did Hoping my picks do better than the Cubs did 
Marion Wilhoite Sports Editor mwilhoite@c-dh.net 
My Chicago Cubs were wiped out way to fast. Perhaps it was because the statue of Harry Carey was temporarily removed from Wrigley Field grounds because of the remodeling. 
Pitching was certainly a key for the Mets, and likely will be in the World Series. Pitching in baseball brings to the field what defense does in football. Teams that score a lot of points are good enough on defense to control the tempo of the game. 
Nonetheless, it time for me to make my Week 10 picks and hopefully I fared better than the Cubbies. 
Mt. Pleasant vs. Summertown 
The Tigers have the speed advantage on the Eagles, who will be wrapping up their first varsity season tonight in Lawrenceburg. 
Mt. Pleasant over Summertown 
Sonny Moore’s pick: Mt. Pleasant by 26. 
Zion Christian at Mt. Juliet Christian 
The Eagles will fly into Mt. Juliet with a productive offense. Defense, however, is a key. 
Mt. Juliet Christian over Zion Christian 
Sonny Moore’s pick: Mt. Juliet Christian by 16. 
Lipscomb Academy at Spring Hill 
Both the Mustangs and the Raiders have played a challenging schedule, and their records are reversed, but don’t be surprised at the score when the final horn sounds. 
Spring Hill over Lipscomb Academy 
Sonny Moore’s pick: Lipscomb by 10. 
Stewart’s Creek at Summit 
Every other week it seems that the Spartans pull a stunning upset. Can Summit make it three in a row? 
Stewarts Creek over Summit 
Sonny Moore’s pick : Stewarts Creek by 13. 
Shelbyville at Columbia Central 
The Eagles have to win, or they will be eliminated from playoff contention. It’s the final home game for the Lions seniors, it’s “Pink Out” and a TV game … and the ‘59 Lions who won their first game played on this field would like to see the 2015 Lions prevail. 
Shelbyville over Columbia Central 
Sonny Moore’s pick : Shelbyville by 11. 
Columbia Academy at Whitwell 
The Bulldogs travel over Monteagle to meet the Tigers, who will likely fill a No. 2 spot behind South Pittsburgh in the playoff bracket opposite an area team from our Region 4. CA will have to adjust to a different environment, but it will help for a road playoff game. 
Columbia Academy over Whitwell 
Sonny Moore’s pick : CA by 22 points. 
Other games: Independence over Franklin County; Lincoln County over LaVergne; Lawrence County over Lewis County; Giles County over Signal Mountain; Page over White House; Marshall County over Maplewood; Pearl-Cohn over Tullahoma; Hillwood over Hickman County; Sycamore over Stewart County; Fayetteville over Cornesville; Moore County over Richland; Huntland over Grace Christian; Forrest over Eagleville; Westmoreland over Cascade; Watertown over Community; Jackson County over East Robertson; Harpeth over Cheatham County; Wayne County over Huntingdon; Colliwood over McEwen; Hollow Rock-Bruceton over Houston County; Clarksville Academy over Perry County; Decatur Riverside over McKenzie. 
Last Week: 13-4, 80.9 percent 
For the Year: 135-38, 78.3 percent
